snippet: Prosecutors have opened an investigation into how one of the world’s largest private art collections was transferred from a private foundation to the global charity Unicef.
abstract: Swiss authorities open new inquiry into ownership of art collection that was transferred to Unicef in Germany after death of collector Dr Gustov Rau; 92 works from collection are set to be auctioned at Bonhams in London.

byline.original: By DOREEN CARVAJAL and KATRIN BENNHOLD
byline.contributor: Doreen Carvajal reported from Zurich, and Katrin Bennhold from London.

lead_paragraph: Prosecutors have opened an investigation into how one of the world’s largest private art collections was transferred from a private foundation to the global charity Unicef.

headline.main: Swiss Open Inquiry Into Collection That Was Transferred to Unicef
headline.print_headline: Swiss Open Inquiry Into Collection That Was Transferred to Unicef
